value.name: trigger_recorder
value.description: If true, detected motion will start the recorder.

value.name: recorder_keepalive
value.description: If true, recording will continue until no motion is detected.

value.name: max_recorder_keepalive
value.description:
Value in seconds for how long motion is allowed to keep the recorder going when no objects are detected.
Use this to prevent never-ending recordings.
Only applicable if recorder_keepalive: true.
A value of 0 disables this functionality.

value.name: fps
value.description:
The FPS at which the motion detector runs.
Higher values will result in more scanning, which uses more resources.

value.name: area
value.description: How big the detected area must be in order to trigger motion.

value.name: width
value.description: Frames will be resized to this width before applying the motion detection algorithm to save computing power.

value.name: height
value.description: Frames will be resized to this height before applying the motion detection algorithm to save computing power.

values.name: coordinates
values.description: List of X and Y coordinates to form a polygon

value.name: mask
value.description: A mask is used to exclude certain areas in the image from motion detection.

value.name: threshold
value.description: The minimum allowed difference between our current frame and averaged frame for a given pixel to be considered motion. A smaller value leads to higher sensitivity and a larger value leads to lower sensitivity.

value.name: alpha
value.description:
How much the current image impacts the moving average.
Higher values impacts the average frame a lot and very small changes may trigger motion.
Lower value impacts the average less, and fast objects may not trigger motion. More can be read here.
Camera identifier. Valid characters are lowercase a-z, numbers and underscores.

value.name: cameras
value.description: Camera-specific configuration. All subordinate keys corresponds to the camera_identifier of a configured camera.
